item.Name: Battle ended due to system failure

achv.Name: Lessons of History: Operation Spring Awakening
Lessons of History: Battle of Kursk
Lessons of History: Battle of the Bulge (1944)
Lessons of History: Battle of Berlin
Lessons of History: Siege of Tobruk

PM.name: LT-1: For Victory!
PM.desc: At lower tiers, some light tanks have almost as much firepower as heavier vehicles.
PM.Hint: Still, try to avoid face-to-face combat. Instead, try to hit enemies in the side or rear. Observe where the enemy vehicle's gun is pointing and approach from the other side.

Primary.req: • Win the battle.\n• Be among the top 10 players on your team by experience earned.

PM.name: LT-2: Reconnaissance
PM.desc: One of the main objectives of light tanks is to spot enemy vehicles.
PM.Hint: But to spot a few enemy vehicles and get destroyed in the process would be a waste of your valuable tank. A good scout can spot enemies while successfully staying alive.

Primary.req: • Personally spot at least 2 enemy vehicles.

PM.name: LT-3: The Pursuit
PM.desc: Your light tank has enough speed to quickly cross the map and provide support to your allies where your help is needed.
PM.Hint: Always try to flank the enemy and hit them from the rear, where the armor is weakest. Do not linger in one spot. If you change positions frequently, the enemy will have a hard time hitting your vehicle. Remember that light tanks have the same chance of being detected while on the move as when they are stationary.

Primary.req: • Cause damage to enemy vehicles at least 2 times by shooting them.

Secondary.req: • Destroy an enemy vehicle by shooting or ramming it.

PM.name: LT-4: A Forced Halt
PM.desc: Destroy a track of an enemy vehicle, thus immobilizing it and exposing it to the fire of your teammates’ more powerful guns. When you destroy a track of an enemy vehicle you temporarily immobilize it. This will help you and your allies to take better aim.
PM.Hint: To destroy a track most effectively, target the drive wheel at the front or rear of the suspension. Remember that even if your gun is incapable of penetrating the armor of an enemy vehicle, it can always destroy the track. HE shells are best suited for this purpose. You will receive more experience if your allies cause damage to enemy vehicles immobilized by you.

Primary.req: • Destroy a track of an enemy vehicle.

Secondary.req: • Your allies must cause damage to the vehicle immobilized by you.

PM.name: LT-5: The Forward Observer
PM.desc: At the higher tiers, light tanks are very vulnerable to enemy fire. Do what light tanks are made to do: spot enemy vehicles.
PM.Hint: Once you have spotted an enemy, keep it under observation long enough for your teammates to take aim and fire. Do not forget to draw the attention of your allies to the spotted vehicle by selecting \"Requesting fire at…\" from the Command Menu.

Primary.req: • Spot an enemy vehicle and assist your allies in destroying it.

Secondary.req: • Spot enemy vehicles and enable your allies to cause damage to at least 2 vehicles spotted by you.

PM.name: LT-6: Battle Support
PM.desc: Damage caused with your assistance is one of the most important statistics for light tanks. If this statistic is high, that means you were an asset to your team in battle.
PM.Hint: The longer your view range, the better. Try to spot enemy vehicles and hit their tracks while keeping yourself alive. Equipment such as Coated Optics and Binocular Telescope can help you to spot the enemy from a safe distance.

Primary.req: • Enable your allies to cause damage to at least 2 enemy vehicles by spotting them or destroying their tracks.

Secondary.req: • Use the following equipment: Coated Optics or Binocular Telescope.

PM.name: LT-7: The SPG Hunter
PM.desc: Artillery is a priority target for light tanks. Destroying enemy SPGs will greatly increase your team's chance of victory.
PM.Hint: Taking out enemy artillery is not easy. Wait until your teammates have gotten the enemy's attention, and then rush the enemy SPGs. When you engage them, try not to cross in front of their guns. Instead, hit them from the sides and rear.

Primary.req: • Spot an enemy SPG, cause damage or any critical hit to it.

PM.name: LT-8: Get Out of Our Base!
PM.desc: In the heat of battle, it is easy to forget about the defense of your own or the neutral base. Such imprudence may allow the enemy to gain the upper hand and seize the objective rapidly. Remember, your tank has enough speed to break contact and retreat to defend the base and fend off the invaders with precise shots or a daring ramming attack, thus saving your team from an imminent defeat.
PM.Hint: If you are not 100% positive that your shells will penetrate the invader’s armor, load a High-Explosive shell instead. HE shells have a greater probability of causing damage to the enemy vehicle. Remember, all it takes is 1 HP of damage to the enemy vehicle or a damaged module to reset their capture points of your base. When you are attempting to capture a base, try to avoid enemy fire as much as possible.

Primary.req: • Participate in a successful capture of a base or reset enemy capture points of your/neutral base.\n• Win the battle.

Secondary.req: • Destroy an enemy vehicle by shooting or ramming it.

PM.name: LT-9: Hawk-Eyed
PM.desc: Light tanks are the eyes of their team. They help to spot enemy vehicles and keep them visible during the battle.
PM.Hint: Upgrading your turret may improve your view range. This will help you to spot enemy vehicles long before they get close.

Primary.req: • Spot at least 2 enemy vehicles before any enemy vehicle spots you.

PM.name: LT-10: The Maximum Result
PM.desc: The more effective you are in a battle, the more experience you will earn. Show them what a light tank is capable of!
PM.Hint: A good scout knows when to be cautious and when to be aggressive. Stay alert to the flow of battle.

Primary.req: • Be among the top 3 players on your team by experience earned.

PM.name: LT-11: A Fair Fight
PM.desc: The higher the tier of your light tank, the more firepower you get, in addition to your speed, view range, and stealth.
PM.Hint: High-tier light tanks can carry significant firepower. On the one hand, your gun may be inferior to the gun on a heavy tank, but, on the other hand, your gun will probably penetrate a heavy tank's rear armor quite nicely.

Primary.req: • Cause damage at least 4 times to enemy vehicles that are of the same tier as your vehicle or higher.

Secondary.req: • Cause at least 1,000 HP of damage.

PM.name: LT-12: The Ghost
PM.desc: Good concealment increases your chances of survival in battle. Light tanks have great concealment abilities, thanks to their relatively low silhouettes.
PM.Hint: Once the enemy spots you, you will have to stay constantly on the move. But if you have not yet been spotted, find a position in a bush where you can stay concealed while lighting up the enemy. Equip your tank for stealth beforehand.

Primary.req: • Spot enemy vehicles and enable your allies to cause at least 500 HP of damage to vehicles spotted by you. Remain unspotted at the moment when the damage is caused.

Secondary.req: • Use the Camouflage Net equipment, and have a Camouflage that corresponds to the map.

PM.name: LT-13: The Key to Victory (Personal/Platoon)
PM.desc: Victory is easier to achieve when you are part of a Platoon, and even more so when your tactical unit is well coordinated. While you are distracting the enemy and relaying their position, your Platoon members will cause damage to targets spotted by you, bringing your team one step closer to victory. This mission may be completed either as part of a Platoon or on your own; however, the latter is much more difficult.
PM.Hint: If you join a battle as part of a Platoon, make sure that you have solid voice communication among your Platoon members. This will help to save the time you usually spend typing messages in Chat.

Primary.req: • Spot enemy vehicles and enable your allies to cause at least 1,500 HP of damage to enemy vehicles. Spotting damage caused by Platoon mates counts toward this total.\n• Cause at least 1,000 HP of damage to enemy vehicles. Damage caused by Platoon mates counts toward this total.\n• Can be completed either on your own or as part of a Platoon consisting of your light tank and any other vehicles.

Secondary.req: • Personally survive the battle.\n• Win the battle.

PM.name: LT-14: The Battle Watch (Personal/Platoon)
PM.desc: A light tank in a coordinated Platoon can spell disaster for the enemy team. Platoon with vehicles that complement your play style: you might want to go into battle platooned with SPGs, or you may prefer a fast-moving pack of light tanks. Do not be afraid to experiment with different lineups. This mission may be completed either as part of a Platoon or on your own; however, the latter is much more difficult.
PM.Hint: The more experienced players fight alongside you in battle, the higher the combat efficiency of your team. Greatly increase the team's effectiveness by entering a battle in a Platoon. Alternatively, you can play alone if your are confident that you have high enough skill and that your allies will not let you down.

Primary.req: • Spot enemy vehicles and enable your allies to cause at least 2,000 HP of damage to enemy vehicles. Spotting damage caused by Platoon mates counts toward this total.\n• Can be completed either on your own or as part of a Platoon consisting of your light tank and any other vehicles.

PM.name: LT-15: The Aggressive Recon Specialist
PM.desc: It's time to show the enemy what a real light tank can do!
PM.Hint: You are not a bull in a china shop. There is no need to break through right away. Be patient, choose your moment, and appear where the enemy is not expecting you. Your advantages are your speed, maneuverability, and view range—use them wisely. Do not forget that your vehicle also has a gun.

Primary.req: • The total damage caused and the damage caused by your allies upon your spotting or destroying a track of an enemy vehicle must be at least 4,000 HP.

PM.name: HT-1: Debut
PM.desc: The guns of heavy tanks are powerful, but still benefit from skillful aim.
PM.Hint: You will encounter other heavy tanks with very thick armor. Learn to aim at their thinner plates and at weak spots.

Primary.req: • Destroy an enemy vehicle.

Secondary.req: • Cause at least 1,000 HP of damage.

PM.name: HT-2: Point Blank Shooting
PM.desc: Even in the most heated battle your tank can destroy the enemy and survive.
PM.Hint: The closer the enemy vehicle is to you, the harder it is to hit it in Sniper mode. Sometimes, it is better to switch to Arcade aim by pressing the Shift button or using the mouse wheel.

Primary.req: • Destroy an enemy vehicle from a distance of 100 m or less.

Secondary.req: • Cause at least 1,000 HP of damage.

PM.name: HT-3: Omnivorous
PM.desc: Prove that your tank can destroy an enemy vehicle of any type.
PM.Hint: Every type of vehicle employs its own unique tactics on the battlefield. For example, medium tanks can easily outflank opponents, heavy tanks will most likely meet enemies head-on, and tank destroyers will prefer to position themselves on hills or hide behind bushes.

Primary.req: • Destroy at least 2 enemy vehicles of 2 different types.

Secondary.req: • Cause at least 1,000 HP of damage.

PM.name: HT-4: Hit Them Where It Hurts!
PM.desc: You must know not only your own tank, but your opponents' vehicles. Carefully study the vehicles that you are likely to encounter in battle. Hit their weak spots.
PM.Hint: You can immobilize an enemy vehicle by hitting its engine, while just one precise hit to the ammo rack of a vehicle can give you the upper hand in the most difficult duel. Internal modules are the turret ring, engine, fuel tanks, ammo rack, and radio.

Primary.req: • Damage or destroy 1 internal module, or injure a crew member of an enemy vehicle.

Secondary.req: • Survive the battle.\n• Win the battle.

PM.name: HT-5: Target Acquired!
PM.desc: Leave your enemy no chance by hitting them at the first opportunity. Every successful hit brings your team one step closer to victory.
PM.Hint: Constantly evaluate the situation on the battlefield. Often it is better to retreat from a disadvantageous situation, so you can cause more damage later.

Primary.req: • Cause at least 1,000 HP of damage to enemy vehicles at close range (up to the view range of your vehicle).

PM.name: HT-6: A Heavy Target
PM.desc: A heavy tank driver must be prepared to go up against enemy heavy tanks and emerge victorious.
PM.Hint: Most heavy tanks have extremely thick armor on the upper glacis and the front of the turret. If you cannot flank them, try hitting the spots where the frontal armor is the thinnest. Weak spots usually include hatches, observation devices, the commander's cupola, and the lower glacis plate.

Primary.req: • Destroy at least 2 enemy heavy tanks.

PM.name: HT-7: I've Got It Covered
PM.desc: Heavy tanks are great for breakthrough tactics. Break through the enemy defensive lines and capture their base. However, do not underestimate your enemy—they might employ the same tactics.
PM.Hint: Be careful when approaching the enemy base—be ready for a \"warm\" reception. If you prefer defensive tactics, make use of the terrain to find best concealment and vantage points, from which you will be able to defend your own (or the neutral base in an Encounter Battle) against the approaching enemy.

Primary.req: • Participate in a base capture or reset enemy capture points of your base/the neutral base.\n• Win the battle.\n• Cause at least 1,000 HP of damage to enemy vehicles.

PM.name: HT-8: With Guns Blazing
PM.desc: Remember, you can take a hit if necessary. Even if your armor fails you, you have enough hit points to keep fighting.
PM.Hint: As a heavy tank, you are the backbone of your team. Enemy heavy tanks are just as important. Take on enemy heavy tanks as soon as possible and destroy them, or at least keep them busy as long as possible.

Primary.req: • Cause at least 1,000 HP of damage to enemy heavy tanks.

PM.name: HT-9: A Crushing Blow
PM.desc: Often, during close-quarters engagements, you will not have enough time to reload. In this situation, finish an enemy off by ramming them! The weaker the enemy vehicle's armor at the point of impact, the more damage you will cause.
PM.Hint: The driver's skill Controlled Impact and the Spall Liner equipment can significantly reduce the damage done to your vehicle by a ram, at the same time increasing the damage of your own ramming attacks.

Primary.req: • Destroy an enemy vehicle by ramming.

PM.name: HT-10: A Weighty Argument
PM.desc: Keep your gun active and keep yourself alive as long as possible.
PM.Hint: The heat of battle is exactly the time when your tank can show all it is worth. Your great armor protection, if used efficiently, will ensure survival even in an almost hopeless situation. The longer your tank survives in a battle, the more damage you can cause to the enemy.

Primary.req: • Be among the top 3 players on your team by damage caused.

PM.name: HT-11: Not Even a Scratch!
PM.desc: Every module destroyed and crew member injured can become a problem. Try to keep them as safe as possible when breaking through the enemy ranks.
PM.Hint: Use a First Aid Kit or a Repair Kit if the enemy destroys a key module of your vehicle or injures a crew member.

Primary.req: • Cause at least 1,000 HP of damage by the end of a battle.\n• Do not have any damaged/destroyed internal modules or injured crew members of your vehicle.\n• Survive the battle.

PM.name: HT-12: Sturdy Armor
PM.desc: Your armor can block a great amount of damage if you use it well.
PM.Hint: As much as possible, present your front armor to the enemy and hide your flanks and weak spots. Angle your armor to increase its effectiveness.

Primary.req: • Damage blocked by armor must equal or exceed the HP of your vehicle.\n• Cause at least 1,000 HP of damage.

Secondary.req: • Win the battle.\n• Survive the battle.

PM.name: HT-13: Storm the Defense! (Personal/Platoon)
PM.desc: A Platoon of well-coordinated heavy tanks can turn the tide of the most desperate battle. This mission may be completed either as part of a Platoon or on your own; however, the latter is much more difficult.
PM.Hint: When playing as part of a Platoon, protect each other’s flanks and focus your fire on the enemy. Keep each other alive, tear into the enemy, and find a way to win the battle.

Primary.req: • Destroy an enemy vehicle during the first 3 minutes of the battle. Enemy vehicles destroyed by Platoon mates count.\n• Can be completed either on your own or as part of a Platoon consisting of your heavy tank and any other vehicles.

PM.name: HT-14: Take that Hill! (Personal/Platoon)
PM.desc: Destroy all types of enemy vehicles, stop them cold, and leave them with no hope of victory. This mission may be completed either as part of a Platoon or on your own; however, the latter is much more difficult.
PM.Hint: Coordinate with your teammates and cover as much of the battlefield as possible with destructive fire.

Primary.req: • Destroy at least 3 enemy vehicles of 2 different types. Enemy vehicles destroyed by Platoon mates count toward this total.\n• Can be completed either on your own or as part of a Platoon consisting of your heavy tank and any other vehicle.

PM.name: HT-15: Tempered Steel
PM.desc: A heavy tank can hit hard, but it can also take a hit and keep battling. Engage the enemy and keep the pressure on.
PM.Hint: Act carefully. Survive! Try to protect your side and rear armor from enemy fire. Heavy tank can carry almost every battle, that is why they are always high-value targets for enemy SPGs. Keep a cool head and do not let them pin you down.

Primary.req: • Damage caused, damage received, and damage blocked by armor must total at least 6,000 HP.

PM.name: MT-1: First Steps
PM.desc: At lower tiers, most medium tanks can take on any other type of vehicle. But by the middle tiers, you will be facing heavy tanks with superior armor and guns.
PM.Hint: Hit the enemy at any opportunity, but try to avoid their fire as well.

Primary.req: • Cause damage to an enemy vehicle.\n• Win the battle.\n• Be among the top 10 players on your team by experience earned.

PM.name: MT-2: Good Hit!
PM.desc: Every successful hit brings your team one step closer to victory. However, it is not always easy to land a solid hit on an enemy vehicle.
PM.Hint: The penetration chance marker on your reticle shows the chance of penetrating the enemy vehicle at a particular point. A red marker indicates no chance of penetration, yellow indicates low chance of penetration, green indicates a high chance of penetration. Try to aim at the sides or the rear of an enemy vehicle. Look for their weak spots.

Primary.req: • Fire at least 6 shots that cause damage to enemy vehicles.

PM.name: MT-3: The Spearhead
PM.desc: Medium tanks are maneuverable vehicles that have impressive guns.
PM.Hint: Move aggressively to seize control of key terrain, putting the opposing team at a disadvantage.

Primary.req: • Cause damage to an enemy vehicle during the first 2 minutes of the battle.

PM.name: MT-4: Stay Still, Would You?
PM.desc: Destroying an enemy's track can leave them vulnerable to more shots from you or your allies.
PM.Hint: Aim for the drive wheels, the sprocketed wheels at the front or rear of the suspension. Once immobilized, an enemy tank is an easy target. Do not forget to draw the attention of your allies to the target vehicle by selecting \"Requesting fire at…\" from the Command Menu.

Primary.req: • Destroy a track of an enemy vehicle, and cause damage to the immobilized vehicle before its track is repaired.

Secondary.req: • Destroy an immobilized enemy vehicle before its track is repaired.

PM.name: MT-5: Counter-Reconnaissance
PM.desc: One of the objectives of medium tanks is to destroy light tanks.
PM.Hint: Do not let enemy light tanks achieve their main objective! Prevent them from spotting and immobilizing the vehicles of your teammates.

Primary.req: • Cause damage to an enemy light tank by shooting or ramming it.

PM.name: MT-6: Rapid Fire
PM.desc: Medium tanks are flexible, able to achieve a variety of objectives on the battlefield.
PM.Hint: Your tank combines mobility and firepower: use them both. You can help your teammates on one flank, then retreat to the base to protect the SPGs, and then suddenly strike the enemy from the rear—all in one battle.

Primary.req: • Cause damage to enemy vehicles of 3 different types.

PM.name: MT-7: A Surprise Blow
PM.desc: Enemy SPGs are high-priority targets for you. By neutralizing them you will get your team one step closer to victory.
PM.Hint: Enemy artillery can cause heavy damage to your teammates. Break through a flank, rush the enemy base, and neutralize their SPGs.

Primary.req: • Destroy at least 1 enemy SPG.

PM.name: MT-8: Confrontation
PM.desc: A good medium tank driver takes full advantage of the agility and firepower of their tank.
PM.Hint: Seize every opportunity to finish off a damaged enemy tank. Taking an opposing gun out of the game shifts the battle in favor of your team.

Primary.req: • Cause damage to enemy medium tanks at least 3 times by shooting them.\n• The total damage caused to enemy medium tanks must be at least 500 HP.

PM.name: MT-9: A Worthy Opponent
PM.desc: Seeking and destroying enemy heavy tanks is a hard task to accomplish but very beneficial to the team's cause.
PM.Hint: Outflank enemy vehicles, shoot them from concealment, target their weak spots to pick them apart—whatever it takes. Remember that heavy tanks are slower than you, and their turrets have low traverse speed.

Primary.req: • Cause at least 500 HP of damage to enemy heavy tanks that are of the same tier as your vehicle or higher.

PM.name: MT-10: A Versatile Warrior
PM.desc: A medium tank can perform well on any type of map and against any type of enemy vehicles. Having studied the features of your own vehicles, you will know how to emerge victorious in any combat situation.
PM.Hint: Your vehicle is maneuverable. Try exploiting this advantage to outflank enemy vehicles and attacking them from the rear or sides. Vehicles that have weak armor can be destroyed by ramming attacks.

Primary.req: • Cause damage to enemy vehicles at least 2 times by shooting them.

Secondary.req: • Destroy an enemy vehicle by shooting or ramming it.

PM.name: MT-11: Ram Them!
PM.desc: Some situations call for unconventional tactics.
PM.Hint: The higher the speed and the greater your vehicle's weight, the more damage you will cause by ramming an enemy vehicle.

Primary.req: • Cause damage to an enemy vehicle by ramming it.

PM.name: MT-12: The Incinerator
PM.desc: Setting an enemy vehicle on fire is one of the most efficient ways to destroy it.
PM.Hint: Penetrating hits that strike the engine or fuel tanks have a chance of causing a fire. Study diagrams of vehicles to learn where these crucial modules are located.

Primary.req: • Set an enemy vehicle on fire.

Secondary.req: • Be among the top 5 players on your team by experience earned.

PM.name: MT-13: An Active Action (Personal/Platoon)
PM.desc: A Platoon of medium tanks can be of great help to the team on the entire battlefield. This mission may be completed either as part of a Platoon or on your own; however, the latter is much more difficult.
PM.Hint: As soon as you destroy an enemy, move on to the next target. Your teammates most likely need your help somewhere else.

Primary.req: • Cause at least 3,000 HP of damage to enemy vehicles. Damage caused by Platoon mates counts toward this total.\n• Can be completed either on your own or as part of a Platoon consisting of your medium tank and any other vehicles.

Secondary.req: • Personally be among the top 5 players on your team by experience earned.

PM.name: MT-14: Team Play (Personal/Platoon)
PM.desc: In a battle, you must rely on your own skill as well as on your Platoon members and allies. If all members of your team fight as one, victory is guaranteed! This mission may be completed either as part of a Platoon or on your own; however, the latter is much more difficult.
PM.Hint: Select one target at a time and focus your fire. Move aggressively! You can destroy enemy vehicles and rapidly crack the toughest defense. Do not forget to draw the attention of your allies to the spotted vehicle by selecting “Requesting fire at…” from the Command Menu.

Primary.req: • Destroy at least 3 enemy vehicles. Enemy vehicles destroyed by Platoon mates count toward this total.\n• Can be completed either on your own or as part of a Platoon consisting of your medium tank and any other vehicles.

Secondary.req: • Cause at least 1,500 HP of damage. Damage caused by Platoon mates counts toward this total.

PM.name: MT-15: The Hunter and the Hunted
PM.desc: You can turn the tide of the battle by taking out enemy tank destroyers.
PM.Hint: Think where you would position your tank destroyer if you drove one. This may be the spot where an enemy tank destroyer is hiding right now. Often, TDs set up to cover the most common lanes of attack, so try hitting them from an unexpected direction.

Primary.req: • Destroy at least 2 enemy tank destroyers.

PM.name: TD-1: Effective Performance
PM.desc: Tank destroyers are a great choice for those players who like to destroy enemy vehicles from a distance.
PM.Hint: Tank destroyers have serious firepower, but most are relatively fragile. Try engaging from long range—the accuracy of your gun allows for that.

Primary.req: • Be among the top 7 players on your team by experience earned.

PM.name: TD-2: Aimed Fire
PM.desc: Destroying an enemy's vehicles modules and injuring crew members can render it almost useless.
PM.Hint: A successful hit can damage or destroy the enemy vehicle's modules or injure the crew. High-Explosive shells are sometimes effective for this purpose.

Primary.req: • Destroy 1 internal module or injure a crew member of an enemy vehicle.

Secondary.req: • Survive the battle.\n• At the end of the battle, have no injured crew members or damaged/destroyed internal modules.

PM.name: TD-3: Good Hunting!
PM.desc: The most important advantage of tank destroyers is their great firepower.
PM.Hint: Many tank destroyers are lightly armored, and most lack turrets. Engaging at long range is usually the safest tactics.

Primary.req: • Cause damage to at least 2 enemy vehicles.\n• Win the battle.

PM.name: TD-4: Ambush
PM.desc: Concealment is key to the survival of a tank destroyer.
PM.Hint: Try to find a concealed position for firing. A thick bush or a fallen tree will do. A high camouflage rating will help you remain unspotted; so will engaging from long range.

Primary.req: • Destroy an enemy vehicle. Remain unspotted by it at the moment of its destruction.

PM.name: TD-5: A Long-Range Gun
PM.desc: When you drive a tank destroyer, it is important to know how to effectively shoot at long range.
PM.Hint: Wait until you are fully aimed before firing. A hasty shot is often a wasted shot.

Primary.req: • Cause damage to an enemy vehicle from a distance of 300 m or more.

Secondary.req: • Cause at least 1,000 HP of damage.

PM.name: TD-6: They Shall Not Pass!
PM.desc: Try to keep enemy vehicles as far from your position as possible. Destroy them while they are approaching, as it will be much harder to blunt the attack in close combat.
PM.Hint: Make sure that your vehicle is hidden behind bushes or fallen trees before firing. If your vehicle is 15 m behind a bush or fallen tree, you have a better chance of remaining concealed after firing.

Primary.req: • Cause damage to an enemy vehicle from a distance of 250 m or more.

PM.name: TD-7: The First Strike
PM.desc: Do not let the enemy get too close to you: most TDs are thinly armored.
PM.Hint: If an enemy vehicle is charging you and you cannot penetrate its frontal armor, you may be able to destroy its track and get away. Study the parameters of your own vehicle. Some tank destroyers have strong frontal armor that can deflect considerable hits.

Primary.req: • Destroy an enemy vehicle, having received no prior damage to your vehicle.

PM.name: TD-8: A Huge Caliber
PM.desc: As a tank destroyer driver, you will be expected to cause more damage to enemy than the amount of HP of your own vehicle.
PM.Hint: Look for every chance to damage enemy vehicles, but at the same time, also try to survive.

Primary.req: • Cause damage exceeding at least 2 times the hit points of your vehicle.

Secondary.req: • Win the battle.\n• Survive the battle.

PM.name: TD-9: Spot On!
PM.desc: The great characteristics of your gun compensate for the relatively weak armor protection of your vehicle.
PM.Hint: Aim at the weak spots of an enemy vehicle, such as the sides, rear, and lower glacis plate. It is also helpful to know the location of key components such as ammunition racks and fuel tanks. To play most effectively, you may wish to take a few Premium shells into the battle. These shells can penetrate much thicker armor than standard ones.

Primary.req: • Score at least 3 armor-penetrating hits in a row against enemy vehicles.\n• Armor-penetrating hits to one or several enemy vehicles are counted.

PM.name: TD-10: A Hidden Menace
PM.desc: If your tank destroyer is well-concealed, you can strike the unsuspecting enemy without them being able to respond.
PM.Hint: Keep your distance and let your teammates do the spotting. You serve your team by staying out of sight, but in position to fire when the opportunity arises.

Primary.req: • Cause at least 1,000 HP of damage to enemy vehicles. Remain unspotted at the moment when the damage is caused.

PM.name: TD-11: The Key Role
PM.desc: Your powerful gun is a force to be reckoned with. If, of course, you know how to shoot it.
PM.Hint: A major challenge for tank destroyers is surviving the battle long enough to achieve their full damage-dealing potential. You must engage, but you must also stay alive.

Primary.req: • Finish the battle as the top player on your team by damage caused.\n• Cause at least 1,000 HP of damage.

PM.name: TD-12: Big Game Hunting
PM.desc: Armed with your wits and an excellent gun, you can destroy enemy vehicles before they get close. Once an enemy heavy tank has been spotted, you can cause a lot of damage to them before they even spot you.
PM.Hint: You have the potential to carry your team to victory. If you know the weak spots of enemy vehicles, the thickness of their armor cannot save them.

Primary.req: • Destroy an enemy heavy tank.\n• Cause at least 1,000 HP of damage.

PM.name: TD-13: Tank Hunters (Personal/Platoon)
PM.desc: As a Platoon, you can focus your fire and rapidly take down enemy tanks. This mission may be completed either as part of a Platoon or on your own; however, the latter is much more difficult.
PM.Hint: Most tank destroyers have excellent single-shot damage. Coordinate with Platoon mates and fire in volleys. Not many enemy vehicles can stand up to multiple, simultaneous hits.

Primary.req: • Destroy at least 3 enemy vehicles. Enemy vehicles destroyed by Platoon mates count toward this total.\n• Can be completed either on your own or as part of a Platoon consisting of your tank destroyer and any other vehicles.

PM.name: TD-14: Big Hunt (Personal/Platoon)
PM.desc: A well-coordinated Platoon of tank destroyers will not allow the enemy to outflank their team's positions. This mission may be completed either as part of a Platoon or on your own, however, the latter is much more difficult.
PM.Hint: Provide covering fire for members of your Platoon who have taken a beating. Sometimes it is better to draw enemy fire yourself in order to give an ally a chance to retreat to safety.

Primary.req: • Cause at least 20% of the total damage caused to enemy vehicles by your team. Damage caused by Platoon mates counts toward this total.\n• Win the battle.\n• Can be completed either on your own or as part of a Platoon consisting of your tank destroyer and any other vehicles.

PM.name: TD-15: Triumph
PM.desc: When diplomacy fails, the guns start to speak. So get your loaded word in.
PM.Hint: The more damage you cause in a battle, the better the chance of victory for your team. It is a simple rule that you should remember.

Primary.req: • Cause at least 3,000 HP of damage to enemy vehicles.

PM.name: SPG-1: The Sharpshooter
PM.desc: Do not waste your ammunition. It is the precise hits that will bring you victory.
PM.Hint: Be patient and wait until you are fully aimed at the target.

Primary.req: • Score at least 3 hits that cause damage to enemy vehicles.

Secondary.req: • Cause at least 1,000 HP of damage.

PM.name: SPG-2: Hidden and Dangerous
PM.desc: SPGs cannot rely on the thickness of their armor or their speed. If you drive an SPG, learn how to stay concealed during the whole battle.
PM.Hint: The Camouflage Net equipment combined with the Camouflage crew skill will help you stay unspotted.

Primary.req: • Cause at least 500 HP of damage to enemy vehicles. Remain unspotted during the battle.\n• Survive the battle.

PM.name: SPG-3: Howitzer Strike
PM.desc: If you want to become an asset to the team, you have to learn how to shoot effectively first.
PM.Hint: Follow the flow of the battle and support your team. Do not stand in one spot for too long. Retreat or look for another firing position if needed.

Primary.req: • Cause at least 1,000 HP of damage to enemy vehicles.

PM.name: SPG-4: Break On Through
PM.desc: Powerful HE shells can not only cause damage in terms of hit points, but will also have a good chance of damaging or destroying modules or injuring crew members with splash damage.
PM.Hint: A High-Explosive shell is most devastating when it fully penetrates the armor and explodes inside the hull of an enemy vehicle. If your shells have mediocre penetration, try to find an enemy vehicle with an open-top turret, or load a Premium shell.

Primary.req: • Damage or destroy enemy vehicles’ modules or injure members of their crew, totaling at least 3 modules and crew members.\n• The numbers of damaged/destroyed modules and injured crew members across all enemy vehicles you have damaged in the battle are added together.

PM.name: SPG-5: Calculate & Obliterate
PM.desc: The great firepower you possess compensates well for the relatively low durability of your SPG.
PM.Hint: Try to cause damage to enemy vehicles at the first opportunity. Even if your HE shell misses the enemy, a near miss may still cause damage to the target.

Primary.req: • Cause damage exceeding 4 times the hit points of your vehicle.\n• Damage caused to allies is not counted.

PM.name: SPG-6: The Falling Hammer
PM.desc: Often you will fight against vehicles of a higher tier. But that is not a problem for an experienced SPG driver.
PM.Hint: SPGs, with their arcing shell trajectory, can often hit a target on the top of the turret or the engine deck, areas where the armor protection is usually weak. Enemy vehicles with open turrets are even more vulnerable to destruction from above. Against the heaviest targets, you may have to resort to Premium shells.

Primary.req: • Destroy at least 2 enemy vehicles of the same tier as your vehicle or higher.

PM.name: SPG-7: Roll Out the Big Guns
PM.desc: You should destroy enemy tank destroyers and SPGs any chance you get. Taking them out may turn the tide of battle in your favor.
PM.Hint: Coordinate your actions with allied light tanks. Spotting enemy tank destroyers and SPGs and destroying them can help to achieve superiority on the battlefield.

Primary.req: • Destroy an enemy tank destroyer or SPG.

Secondary.req: • Cause at least 1,000 HP of damage.

PM.name: SPG-8: Heavy Fire on Heavy Tanks!
PM.desc: A heavy tank is a hard target, but not for your gun. The sight of heavy tank in the open should make you smile.
PM.Hint: Heavy tanks generally move more slowly than other types of vehicles. Therefore, you can often predict where the tank will be when your shell arrives. For an SPG driver, it is useful to know the speed of your shells.

Primary.req: • Cause at least 1,000 HP of damage to enemy heavy tanks.

PM.name: SPG-9: Lead Them Til You Hit Them
PM.desc: An experienced SPG driver can easily hit moving vehicles. Learn to effectively predict the movement of enemy vehicles when firing. Remember that a direct hit can cause much more damage to an enemy vehicle than an HE splash.
PM.Hint: Knowing the velocity of your shells is crucial. By estimating how long the shell will take to reach the aim point, you can correctly lead a moving target.

Primary.req: • Damage an enemy vehicle that is moving at a speed of at least 20 km/h.\n• Both splash damage and the damage caused by direct hits is counted.\n• Damage caused by ramming is not counted.

PM.name: SPG-10: The Bane of Artillery
PM.desc: Artillery can be quite good at destroying artillery. Watch for falling trees and broken fences. Predict where an enemy SPG may be hiding and send a shell to test your hypothesis.
PM.Hint: As you become more experienced with artillery, you will get to know the \"standard\" artillery hiding places on each map. Make enemy SPGs pay for their lack of creativity.

Primary.req: • Destroy at least 1 enemy SPG.

PM.name: SPG-11: The Area of Effect
PM.desc: Your HE shells can not only destroy an enemy vehicle in one hit, but they can also cause significant damage to multiple targets at once if they are located close together.
PM.Hint: Keep your eye on choke points and busy corners where vehicles are likely to stack up. You can literally kill two birds with one stone. And ammunition is not free: think of the savings!

Primary.req: • Destroy an enemy vehicle with a single shot.\n• Only targets that received no prior damage in the battle are counted.

PM.name: SPG-12: The Striker
PM.desc: Playing an SPG is drastically different from playing any other vehicle type. But the main objective is the same—do your best in battle, and contribute as much as you can to the team's cause.
PM.Hint: Do not switch to Artillery mode at the very beginning of the battle. First, decide on a good firing position.

Primary.req: • Be among the top 3 players on your team by damage caused.\n• Destroy an enemy vehicle.

PM.name: SPG-13: The Artillery Battery (Personal/Platoon)
PM.desc: A Platoon of well-handled SPGs should make the enemy team extremely worried. Coordinate your actions and focus your fire on one enemy target at a time. This mission may be completed either as part of a Platoon or on your own, however, the latter is much more difficult.
PM.Hint: By spreading out, your Platoon can hit targets from different angles, rendering many rocks and buildings useless as cover and dominating the map.

Primary.req: • Cause at least 15% of the total damage caused to enemy vehicles by your team. Damage caused by Platoon mates counts toward this total.\n• Win the battle.\n• Can be completed either on your own or as part of a Platoon consisting of your SPG and any other vehicles.

PM.name: SPG-14: Joint Offensive (Personal/Platoon)
PM.desc: Artillery is dependent on the rest of the team to be successful. Artillery and light tanks complement each other especially well in a Platoon. This mission may be completed either as part of a Platoon or on your own, however, the latter is much more difficult.
PM.Hint: A light tank can spot enemy vehicles and immobilize them, allowing SPGs to make short work of the unfortunate victim. A heavy tank can shield allies with its thick armor, a medium tank can distract the enemy, while a tank destroyer can provide fire support at long range. Together we will win!

Primary.req: • Cause at least 2,000 HP of damage to enemy heavy tanks and tank destroyers. Damage caused by Platoon mates counts toward this total.\n• Can be completed either on your own or as part of a Platoon consisting of your SPG and any other vehicles.

PM.name: SPG-15: War Gods
PM.desc: An SPG, played well and properly supported, can be a dominant weapon.
PM.Hint: Know the technical characteristics of your SPG and plan your actions accordingly. Sometimes, remaining at the base is not a very good idea. If you are driving a fast SPG, you can quickly change positions and engage the enemy from an unexpected direction.

Primary.req: • Be among the top 3 players on your team by experience earned and damage caused.\n• Cause at least 2,000 HP of damage.

PM.name: LT-1: For Victory!
PM.desc: At lower tiers, some light tanks have almost as much firepower as heavier vehicles.
PM.Hint: Still, try to avoid face-to-face combat. Instead, try to hit enemies in the side or rear. Observe where the enemy vehicle's gun is pointing and approach from the other side.

Primary.req: • Win the battle.\n• Be among the top 5 players on your team by experience earned.

PM.name: LT-2: Reconnaissance
PM.desc: One of the main objectives of light tanks is to spot enemy vehicles.
PM.Hint: But to spot a few enemy vehicles and get destroyed in the process would be a waste of your valuable tank. A good scout can spot enemies while successfully staying alive.

Primary.req: • Personally spot at least 4 enemy vehicles.

Secondary.req: • Survive the battle.\n• Win the battle.

PM.name: LT-3: The Pursuit
PM.desc: Your light tank has enough speed to quickly cross the map and provide support to your allies where your help is needed.
PM.Hint: Always try to flank the enemy and hit them from the rear, where the armor is weakest. Do not linger in one spot. If you change positions frequently, the enemy will have a hard time hitting your vehicle. Remember that light tanks have the same chance of being detected while on the move as when they are stationary.

Primary.req: • Cause damage to enemy vehicles at least 3 times by shooting them.

Secondary.req: • Destroy at least 2 enemy vehicles by shooting or ramming them.

PM.name: LT-4: A Forced Halt
PM.desc: Destroy a track of an enemy vehicle, thus immobilizing it and exposing it to the fire of your teammates’ more powerful guns. When you destroy a track of an enemy vehicle you temporarily immobilize it. This will help you and your allies to take better aim.
PM.Hint: To destroy a track most effectively, target the drive wheel at the front or rear of the suspension. Remember that even if your gun is incapable of penetrating the armor of an enemy vehicle, it can always destroy the track. HE shells are best suited for this purpose. You will receive more experience if your allies cause damage to enemy vehicles immobilized by you.

Primary.req: • Destroy a track of an enemy vehicle.\n• Allies must cause at least 250 HP of damage to the immobilized enemy vehicle before its tracks are repaired.

Secondary.req: • Your allies must destroy at least 1 vehicle immobilized by you.

PM.name: LT-5: The Forward Observer
PM.desc: At the higher tiers, light tanks are very vulnerable to enemy fire. Do what light tanks are made to do: spot enemy vehicles.
PM.Hint: Once you have spotted an enemy, keep it under observation long enough for your teammates to take aim and fire. Do not forget to draw the attention of your allies to the spotted vehicle by selecting \"Requesting fire at…\" from the Command Menu.

Primary.req: • Spot enemy vehicles and enable your allies to destroy at least 2 vehicles spotted by you.

Secondary.req: • Spot enemy vehicles and enable your allies to cause damage to at least 4 vehicles spotted by you.

PM.name: LT-6: Battle Support
PM.desc: Damage caused with your assistance is one of the most important statistics for light tanks. If this statistic is high, that means you were an asset to your team in battle.
PM.Hint: The longer your view range, the better. Try to spot enemy vehicles and hit their tracks while keeping yourself alive. Equipment such as Coated Optics and Binocular Telescope can help you to spot the enemy from a safe distance.

Primary.req: • Enable your allies to cause damage to at least 4 enemy vehicles by spotting them or destroying their tracks.

Secondary.req: • Spot an enemy vehicle or destroy its tracks. This enemy vehicle must be destroyed while spotted, or before its tracks are repaired.

PM.name: LT-7: The SPG Hunter
PM.desc: Artillery is a priority target for light tanks. Destroying enemy SPGs will greatly increase your team's chance of victory.
PM.Hint: Taking out enemy artillery is not easy. Wait until your teammates have gotten the enemy's attention, and then rush the enemy SPGs. When you engage them, try not to cross in front of their guns. Instead, hit them from the sides and rear.

Primary.req: • Spot at least 2 enemy SPGs and cause damage or critical hits to them.

PM.name: LT-8: Get Out of Our Base!
PM.desc: In the heat of battle, it is easy to forget about the defense of your own or the neutral base. Such imprudence may allow the enemy to gain the upper hand and seize the objective rapidly. Remember, your tank has enough speed to break contact and retreat to defend the base and fend off the invaders with precise shots or a daring ramming attack, thus saving your team from an imminent defeat.
PM.Hint: If you are not 100% positive that your shells will penetrate the invader’s armor, load a High-Explosive shell instead. HE shells have a greater probability of causing damage to the enemy vehicle. Remember, all it takes is 1 HP of damage to the enemy vehicle or a damaged module to reset their capture points of your base. When you are attempting to capture a base, try to avoid enemy fire as much as possible.

Primary.req: • Participate in a successful capture of a base while earning at least 20 base capture points, or reset enemy capture points of your/neutral base while earning at least 20 base defense points.\n• Win the battle.

Secondary.req: • Destroy an enemy vehicle by shooting or ramming it.

PM.name: LT-9: Hawk-Eyed
PM.desc: Light tanks are the eyes of their team. They help to spot enemy vehicles and keep them visible during the battle.
PM.Hint: Upgrading your turret may improve your view range. This will help you to spot enemy vehicles long before they get close.

Primary.req: • Spot at least 4 enemy vehicles before any enemy vehicle spots you.

PM.name: LT-10: The Maximum Result
PM.desc: The more effective you are in a battle, the more experience you will earn. Show them what a light tank is capable of!
PM.Hint: A good scout knows when to be cautious and when to be aggressive. Stay alert to the flow of battle.

Primary.req: • Finish the battle as the top player on your team by experience earned.

PM.name: LT-11: A Fair Fight
PM.desc: The higher the tier of your light tank, the more firepower you get, in addition to your speed, view range, and stealth.
PM.Hint: High-tier light tanks can carry significant firepower. On the one hand, your gun may be inferior to the gun on a heavy tank, but, on the other hand, your gun will probably penetrate a heavy tank's rear armor quite nicely.

Primary.req: • Cause damage at least 6 times to enemy vehicles that are of the same tier as your vehicle or higher.

Secondary.req: • Cause at least 1,500 HP of damage.

PM.name: LT-12: The Ghost
PM.desc: Good concealment increases your chances of survival in battle. Light tanks have great concealment abilities, thanks to their relatively low silhouettes.
PM.Hint: Once the enemy spots you, you will have to stay constantly on the move. But if you have not yet been spotted, find a position in a bush where you can stay concealed while lighting up the enemy. Equip your tank for stealth beforehand.

Primary.req: • Spot enemy vehicles and enable your allies to cause at least 1,000 HP of damage to vehicles spotted by you. Remain unspotted at the moment when the damage is caused.

PM.name: LT-13: The Key to Victory (Personal/Platoon)
PM.desc: Victory is easier to achieve when you are part of a Platoon, and even more so when your tactical unit is well coordinated. While you are distracting the enemy and relaying their position, your Platoon members will cause damage to targets spotted by you, bringing your team one step closer to victory. This mission may be completed either as part of a Platoon or on your own; however, the latter is much more difficult.
PM.Hint: If you join a battle as part of a Platoon, make sure that you have solid voice communication among your Platoon members. This will help to save the time you usually spend typing messages in Chat.

Primary.req: • Spot enemy vehicles and enable your allies to cause at least 2,000 HP of damage to enemy vehicles. Spotting damage caused by Platoon mates counts toward this total.\n• Cause at least 1,500 HP of damage to enemy vehicles. Damage caused by Platoon mates counts toward this total.\n• Can be completed either on your own or as part of a Platoon consisting of your light tank and any other vehicles.

Secondary.req: • Personally survive the battle.\n• Win the battle.

PM.name: LT-14: The Battle Watch (Personal/Platoon)
PM.desc: A light tank in a coordinated Platoon can spell disaster for the enemy team. Platoon with vehicles that complement your play style: you might want to go into battle platooned with SPGs, or you may prefer a fast-moving pack of light tanks. Do not be afraid to experiment with different lineups. This mission may be completed either as part of a Platoon or on your own; however, the latter is much more difficult.
PM.Hint: The more experienced players fight alongside you in battle, the higher the combat efficiency of your team. Greatly increase the team's effectiveness by entering a battle in a Platoon. Alternatively, you can play alone if your are confident that you have high enough skill and that your allies will not let you down.

Primary.req: • Spot enemy vehicles and enable your allies to cause at least 3,000 HP of damage to enemy vehicles. Spotting damage caused by Platoon mates counts toward this total.\n• Can be completed either on your own or as part of a Platoon consisting of your light tank and any other vehicles.

PM.name: LT-15: The Aggressive Recon Specialist
PM.desc: It's time to show the enemy what a real light tank can do!
PM.Hint: You are not a bull in a china shop. There is no need to break through right away. Be patient, choose your moment, and appear where the enemy is not expecting you. Your advantages are your speed, maneuverability, and view range—use them wisely. Do not forget that your vehicle also has a gun.

Primary.req: • The total damage caused and the damage caused by your allies upon your spotting or destroying a track of an enemy vehicle must be at least 5,000 HP.

PM.name: HT-1: Debut
PM.desc: The guns of heavy tanks are powerful, but still benefit from skillful aim.
PM.Hint: You will encounter other heavy tanks with very thick armor. Learn to aim at their thinner plates and at weak spots.

Primary.req: • Destroy at least 2 enemy vehicles.

Secondary.req: • Cause at least 2,000 HP of damage.

PM.name: HT-2: Point Blank Shooting
PM.desc: Even in the most heated battle your tank can destroy the enemy and survive.
PM.Hint: The closer the enemy vehicle is to you, the harder it is to hit it in Sniper mode. Sometimes, it is better to switch to Arcade aim by pressing the Shift button or using the mouse wheel.

Primary.req: • Destroy at least 2 enemy vehicles from a distance of 100 meters or less.

Secondary.req: • Cause at least 2,000 HP of damage.

PM.name: HT-3: Omnivorous
PM.desc: Prove that your tank can destroy an enemy vehicle of any type.
PM.Hint: Every type of vehicle employs its own unique tactics on the battlefield. For example, medium tanks can easily outflank opponents, heavy tanks will most likely meet enemies head-on, and tank destroyers will prefer to position themselves on hills or hide behind bushes.

Primary.req: • Destroy at least 3 enemy vehicles of 2 different types.

Secondary.req: • Cause at least 2,000 HP of damage.

PM.name: HT-4: Hit Them Where It Hurts!
PM.desc: You must know not only your own tank, but your opponents' vehicles. Carefully study the vehicles that you are likely to encounter in battle. Hit their weak spots.
PM.Hint: You can immobilize an enemy vehicle by hitting its engine, while just one precise hit to the ammo rack of a vehicle can give you the upper hand in the most difficult duel. Internal modules are the turret ring, engine, fuel tanks, ammo rack, and radio.

Primary.req: • Damage or destroy enemy vehicles’ internal modules or injure members of their crew, totaling at least 3 modules and crew members.\n• The numbers of damaged/destroyed modules and injured crew members across all enemy vehicles you have damaged in the battle are added together.

PM.name: HT-5: Target Acquired!
PM.desc: Leave your enemy no chance by hitting them at the first opportunity. Every successful hit brings your team one step closer to victory.
PM.Hint: Constantly evaluate the situation on the battlefield. Often it is better to retreat from a disadvantageous situation, so you can cause more damage later.

Primary.req: • Cause at least 2,000 HP of damage to enemy vehicles at close range (up to the view range of your vehicle).

PM.name: HT-6: A Heavy Target
PM.desc: A heavy tank driver must be prepared to go up against enemy heavy tanks and emerge victorious.
PM.Hint: Most heavy tanks have extremely thick armor on the upper glacis and the front of the turret. If you cannot flank them, try hitting the spots where the frontal armor is the thinnest. Weak spots usually include hatches, observation devices, the commander's cupola, and the lower glacis plate.

Primary.req: • Destroy at least 3 enemy heavy tanks.

Secondary.req: • Survive the battle.\n• Win the battle.

PM.name: HT-7: I've Got It Covered
PM.desc: Heavy tanks are great for breakthrough tactics. Break through the enemy defensive lines and capture their base. However, do not underestimate your enemy—they might employ the same tactics.
PM.Hint: Be careful when approaching the enemy base—be ready for a \"warm\" reception. If you prefer defensive tactics, make use of the terrain to find best concealment and vantage points, from which you will be able to defend your own (or the neutral base in an Encounter Battle) against the approaching enemy.

Primary.req: • Participate in a base capture or reset enemy capture points of your base/the neutral base.\n• Win the battle.\n• Cause at least 2,000 HP of damage to enemy vehicles.

PM.name: HT-8: With Guns Blazing
PM.desc: Remember, you can take a hit if necessary. Even if your armor fails you, you have enough hit points to keep fighting.
PM.Hint: As a heavy tank, you are the backbone of your team. Enemy heavy tanks are just as important. Take on enemy heavy tanks as soon as possible and destroy them, or at least keep them busy as long as possible.

Primary.req: • Cause at least 2,000 HP of damage to enemy heavy tanks.

PM.name: HT-9: A Crushing Blow
PM.desc: Often, during close-quarters engagements, you will not have enough time to reload. In this situation, finish an enemy off by ramming them! The weaker the enemy vehicle's armor at the point of impact, the more damage you will cause.
PM.Hint: The driver's skill Controlled Impact and the Spall Liner equipment can significantly reduce the damage done to your vehicle by a ram, at the same time increasing the damage of your own ramming attacks.

Primary.req: • Destroy an enemy vehicle by ramming.\n• Survive the ramming attack on the enemy.

PM.name: HT-10: A Weighty Argument
PM.desc: Keep your gun active and keep yourself alive as long as possible.
PM.Hint: The heat of battle is exactly the time when your tank can show all it is worth. Your great armor protection, if used efficiently, will ensure survival even in an almost hopeless situation. The longer your tank survives in a battle, the more damage you can cause to the enemy.

Primary.req: • Be among the top 3 players on both teams by damage caused.

PM.name: HT-11: Not Even a Scratch!
PM.desc: Every module destroyed and crew member injured can become a problem. Try to keep them as safe as possible when breaking through the enemy ranks.
PM.Hint: Use a First Aid Kit or a Repair Kit if the enemy destroys a key module of your vehicle or injures a crew member.

Primary.req: • Cause at least 2,000 HP of damage by the end of a battle.\n• Do not have any damaged/destroyed internal modules or injured crew members of your vehicle.\n• Survive the battle.

PM.name: HT-12: Sturdy Armor
PM.desc: Your armor can block a great amount of damage if you use it well.
PM.Hint: As much as possible, present your front armor to the enemy and hide your flanks and weak spots. Angle your armor to increase its effectiveness.

Primary.req: • Damage blocked by armor must be at least double the HP of your vehicle.\n• Cause at least 1,500 HP of damage.

Secondary.req: • Win the battle.\n• Survive the battle.

PM.name: HT-13: Storm the Defense! (Personal/Platoon)
PM.desc: A Platoon of well-coordinated heavy tanks can turn the tide of the most desperate battle. This mission may be completed either as part of a Platoon or on your own; however, the latter is much more difficult.
PM.Hint: When playing as part of a Platoon, protect each other’s flanks and focus your fire on the enemy. Keep each other alive, tear into the enemy, and find a way to win the battle.

Primary.req: • Destroy at least 2 enemy vehicles during the first 3 minutes of the battle. Enemy vehicles destroyed by Platoon mates count toward this total.\n• Can be completed either on your own or as part of a Platoon consisting of your heavy tank and any other vehicles.

PM.name: HT-14: Take that Hill! (Personal/Platoon)
PM.desc: Destroy all types of enemy vehicles, stop them cold, and leave them with no hope of victory. This mission may be completed either as part of a Platoon or on your own; however, the latter is much more difficult.
PM.Hint: Coordinate with your teammates and cover as much of the battlefield as possible with destructive fire.

Primary.req: • Destroy at least 4 enemy vehicles of 2 different types. Enemy vehicles destroyed by Platoon mates count toward this total.\n• Can be completed either on your own or as part of a Platoon consisting of your heavy tank and any other vehicles.

PM.name: HT-15: Tempered Steel
PM.desc: A heavy tank can hit hard, but it can also take a hit and keep battling. Engage the enemy and keep the pressure on.
PM.Hint: Act carefully. Survive! Try to protect your side and rear armor from enemy fire. Heavy tank can carry almost every battle, that is why they are always high-value targets for enemy SPGs. Keep a cool head and do not let them pin you down.

Primary.req: • Damage caused, damage received, and damage blocked by armor must total at least 8,000 HP.

PM.name: MT-1: First Steps
PM.desc: At lower tiers, most medium tanks can take on any other type of vehicle. But by the middle tiers, you will be facing heavy tanks with superior armor and guns.
PM.Hint: Hit the enemy at any opportunity, but try to avoid their fire as well.

Primary.req: • Cause damage to an enemy vehicle.\n• Win the battle.\n• Be among the top 5 players on your team by experience earned.

PM.name: MT-2: Good Hit!
PM.desc: Every successful hit brings your team one step closer to victory. However, it is not always easy to land a solid hit on an enemy vehicle.
PM.Hint: The penetration chance marker on your reticle shows the chance of penetrating the enemy vehicle at a particular point. A red marker indicates no chance of penetration, yellow indicates low chance of penetration, green indicates a high chance of penetration. Try to aim at the sides or the rear of an enemy vehicle. Look for their weak spots.

Primary.req: • Fire at least 9 shots that cause damage to enemy vehicles.

PM.name: MT-3: The Spearhead
PM.desc: Medium tanks are maneuverable vehicles that have impressive guns.
PM.Hint: Move aggressively to seize control of key terrain, putting the opposing team at a disadvantage.

Primary.req: • Cause at least 750 HP of damage to enemy vehicles during the first 2 minutes of the battle.

PM.name: MT-4: Stay Still, Would You?
PM.desc: Destroying an enemy's track can leave them vulnerable to more shots from you or your allies.
PM.Hint: Aim for the drive wheels, the sprocketed wheels at the front or rear of the suspension. Once immobilized, an enemy tank is an easy target. Do not forget to draw the attention of your allies to the target vehicle by selecting \"Requesting fire at…\" from the Command Menu.

Primary.req: • Destroy the tracks of 2 different enemy vehicles and cause damage to immobilized vehicles at least 2 times.

Secondary.req: • Destroy an immobilized enemy vehicle before its track is repaired.

PM.name: MT-5: Counter-Reconnaissance
PM.desc: One of the objectives of medium tanks is to destroy light tanks.
PM.Hint: Do not let enemy light tanks achieve their main objective! Prevent them from spotting and immobilizing the vehicles of your teammates.

Primary.req: • Destroy an enemy light tank by shooting or ramming it.

PM.name: MT-6: Rapid Fire
PM.desc: Medium tanks are flexible, able to achieve a variety of objectives on the battlefield.
PM.Hint: Your tank combines mobility and firepower: use them both. You can help your teammates on one flank, then retreat to the base to protect the SPGs, and then suddenly strike the enemy from the rear—all in one battle.

Primary.req: • Cause at least 3,000 HP of damage to enemy vehicles of 3 different types.

PM.name: MT-7: A Surprise Blow
PM.desc: Enemy SPGs are high-priority targets for you. By neutralizing them you will get your team one step closer to victory.
PM.Hint: Enemy artillery can cause heavy damage to your teammates. Break through a flank, rush the enemy base, and neutralize their SPGs.

Primary.req: • Destroy at least 2 enemy SPGs.

Secondary.req: • Survive the battle.\n• Win the battle.

PM.name: MT-8: Confrontation
PM.desc: A good medium tank driver takes full advantage of the agility and firepower of their tank.
PM.Hint: Seize every opportunity to finish off a damaged enemy tank. Taking an opposing gun out of the game shifts the battle in favor of your team.

Primary.req: • Cause damage to enemy medium tanks at least 5 times by shooting them.\n• The total damage caused to enemy medium tanks must be at least 1,000 HP.

Secondary.req: • Survive the battle.\n• Win the battle.

PM.name: MT-9: A Worthy Opponent
PM.desc: Seeking and destroying enemy heavy tanks is a hard task to accomplish but very beneficial to the team's cause.
PM.Hint: Outflank enemy vehicles, shoot them from concealment, target their weak spots to pick them apart—whatever it takes. Remember that heavy tanks are slower than you, and their turrets have low traverse speed.

Primary.req: • Cause at least 1,000 HP of damage to enemy heavy tanks that are of the same tier as your vehicle or higher.

Secondary.req: • Survive the battle.\n• Win the battle.

PM.name: MT-10: A Versatile Warrior
PM.desc: A medium tank can perform well on any type of map and against any type of enemy vehicles. Having studied the features of your own vehicles, you will know how to emerge victorious in any combat situation.
PM.Hint: Your vehicle is maneuverable. Try exploiting this advantage to outflank enemy vehicles and attacking them from the rear or sides. Vehicles that have weak armor can be destroyed by ramming attacks.

Primary.req: • Cause damage to enemy vehicles at least 4 times by shooting them.

Secondary.req: • Destroy at least 2 enemy vehicles by shooting or ramming them.

PM.name: MT-11: Ram Them!
PM.desc: Some situations call for unconventional tactics.
PM.Hint: The higher the speed and the greater your vehicle's weight, the more damage you will cause by ramming an enemy vehicle.

Primary.req: • Destroy an enemy vehicle by ramming it.

PM.name: MT-12: The Incinerator
PM.desc: Setting an enemy vehicle on fire is one of the most efficient ways to destroy it.
PM.Hint: Penetrating hits that strike the engine or fuel tanks have a chance of causing a fire. Study diagrams of vehicles to learn where these crucial modules are located.

Primary.req: • Set an enemy vehicle on fire.\n• Cause at least 2,000 HP of damage to enemy vehicles.

Secondary.req: • Be among the top 3 players on your team by experience earned.

PM.name: MT-13: An Active Action (Personal/Platoon)
PM.desc: A Platoon of medium tanks can be of great help to the team on the entire battlefield. This mission may be completed either as part of a Platoon or on your own; however, the latter is much more difficult.
PM.Hint: As soon as you destroy an enemy, move on to the next target. Your teammates most likely need your help somewhere else.

Primary.req: • Cause at least 4,000 HP of damage to enemy vehicles. Damage caused by Platoon mates counts toward this total.\n• Can be completed either on your own or as part of a Platoon, consisting of your medium tank and any other vehicles.

Secondary.req: • Personally be among the top 5 players on your team by experience earned.

PM.name: MT-14: Team Play (Personal/Platoon)
PM.desc: In a battle, you must rely on your own skill as well as on your Platoon members and allies. If all members of your team fight as one, victory is guaranteed! This mission may be completed either as part of a Platoon or on your own; however, the latter is much more difficult.
PM.Hint: Select one target at a time and focus your fire. Move aggressively! You can destroy enemy vehicles and rapidly crack the toughest defense. Do not forget to draw the attention of your allies to the spotted vehicle by selecting “Requesting fire at…” from the Command Menu.

Primary.req: • Destroy at least 4 enemy vehicles. Enemy vehicles destroyed by Platoon mates count toward this total.\n• Can be completed either on your own or as part of a Platoon consisting of your medium tank and any other vehicles.

Secondary.req: • Cause at least 2,000 HP of damage. Damage caused by Platoon mates counts toward this total.

PM.name: MT-15: The Hunter and the Hunted
PM.desc: You can turn the tide of the battle by taking out enemy tank destroyers.
PM.Hint: Think where you would position your tank destroyer if you drove one. This may be the spot where an enemy tank destroyer is hiding right now. Often, TDs set up to cover the most common lanes of attack, so try hitting them from an unexpected direction.

Primary.req: • Cause at least 2,000 HP of damage to enemy tank destroyers.

Secondary.req: • Survive the battle.\n• Win the battle.

PM.name: TD-1: Effective Performance
PM.desc: Tank destroyers are a great choice for those players who like to destroy enemy vehicles from a distance.
PM.Hint: Tank destroyers have serious firepower, but most are relatively fragile. Try engaging from long range—the accuracy of your gun allows for that.

Primary.req: • Be among the top 5 players on your team by experience earned.

PM.name: TD-2: Aimed Fire
PM.desc: Destroying an enemy's vehicles modules and injuring crew members can render it almost useless.
PM.Hint: A successful hit can damage or destroy the enemy vehicle's modules or injure the crew. High-Explosive shells are sometimes effective for this purpose.

Primary.req: • Cause at least 1,000 HP of damage and destroy 1 or more internal modules, or injure a crew member of an enemy vehicle.

Secondary.req: • Survive the battle.\n• At the end of the battle, have no injured crew members or damaged/destroyed internal modules.

PM.name: TD-3: Good Hunting!
PM.desc: The most important advantage of tank destroyers is their great firepower.
PM.Hint: Many tank destroyers are lightly armored, and most lack turrets. Engaging at long range is usually the safest tactics.

Primary.req: • Cause damage to at least 3 enemy vehicles.\n• Win the battle.

PM.name: TD-4: Ambush
PM.desc: Concealment is key to the survival of a tank destroyer.
PM.Hint: Try to find a concealed position for firing. A thick bush or a fallen tree will do. A high camouflage rating will help you remain unspotted; so will engaging from long range.

Primary.req: • Destroy at least 2 enemy vehicles. Remain unspotted by them at the moment of their destruction.

PM.name: TD-5: A Long-Range Gun
PM.desc: When you drive a tank destroyer, it is important to know how to effectively shoot at long range.
PM.Hint: Wait until you are fully aimed before firing. A hasty shot is often a wasted shot.

Primary.req: • Destroy an enemy vehicle from a distance of 300 m or more.

Secondary.req: • Cause at least 2,000 HP of damage.

PM.name: TD-6: They Shall Not Pass!
PM.desc: Try to keep enemy vehicles as far from your position as possible. Destroy them while they are approaching, as it will be much harder to blunt the attack in close combat.
PM.Hint: Make sure that your vehicle is hidden behind bushes or fallen trees before firing. If your vehicle is 15 m behind a bush or fallen tree, you have a better chance of remaining concealed after firing.

Primary.req: • Cause at least 1,000 HP of damage to enemy vehicles from a distance of over 250 m.

PM.name: TD-7: The First Strike
PM.desc: Do not let the enemy get too close to you: most TDs are thinly armored.
PM.Hint: If an enemy vehicle is charging you and you cannot penetrate its frontal armor, you may be able to destroy its track and get away. Study the parameters of your own vehicle. Some tank destroyers have strong frontal armor that can deflect considerable hits.

Primary.req: • Destroy at least 2 enemy vehicles, having received no prior damage to your vehicle.

PM.name: TD-8: A Huge Caliber
PM.desc: As a tank destroyer driver, you will be expected to cause more damage to enemy than the amount of HP of your own vehicle.
PM.Hint: Look for every chance to damage enemy vehicles, but at the same time, also try to survive.

Primary.req: • Cause damage exceeding at least 3 times the hit points of your vehicle.

Secondary.req: • Win the battle.\n• Survive the battle.

PM.name: TD-9: Spot On!
PM.desc: The great characteristics of your gun compensate for the relatively weak armor protection of your vehicle.
PM.Hint: Aim at the weak spots of an enemy vehicle, such as the sides, rear, and lower glacis plate. It is also helpful to know the location of key components such as ammunition racks and fuel tanks. To play most effectively, you may wish to take a few Premium shells into the battle. These shells can penetrate much thicker armor than standard ones.

Primary.req: • Score at least 4 armor-penetrating hits in a row against enemy vehicles.\n• Armor-penetrating hits to one or several enemy vehicles are counted.

PM.name: TD-10: A Hidden Menace
PM.desc: If your tank destroyer is well-concealed, you can strike the unsuspecting enemy without them being able to respond.
PM.Hint: Keep your distance and let your teammates do the spotting. You serve your team by staying out of sight, but in position to fire when the opportunity arises.

Primary.req: • Cause at least 2,000 HP of damage to enemy vehicles. Remain unspotted at the moment when the damage is caused.

PM.name: TD-11: The Key Role
PM.desc: Your powerful gun is a force to be reckoned with. If, of course, you know how to shoot it.
PM.Hint: A major challenge for tank destroyers is surviving the battle long enough to achieve their full damage-dealing potential. You must engage, but you must also stay alive.

Primary.req: • Finish the battle as the top player on your team by damage caused.\n• Cause at least 2,000 HP of damage.

PM.name: TD-12: Big Game Hunting
PM.desc: Armed with your wits and an excellent gun, you can destroy enemy vehicles before they get close. Once an enemy heavy tank has been spotted, you can cause a lot of damage to them before they even spot you.
PM.Hint: You have the potential to carry your team to victory. If you know the weak spots of enemy vehicles, the thickness of their armor cannot save them.

Primary.req: • Destroy an enemy heavy tank that is 1 tier higher than your vehicle.\n• Cause at least 2,000 HP of damage.

PM.name: TD-13: Tank Hunters (Personal/Platoon)
PM.desc: As a Platoon, you can focus your fire and rapidly take down enemy tanks. This mission may be completed either as part of a Platoon or on your own; however, the latter is much more difficult.
PM.Hint: Most tank destroyers have excellent single-shot damage. Coordinate with Platoon mates and fire in volleys. Not many enemy vehicles can stand up to multiple, simultaneous hits.

Primary.req: • Destroy at least 4 enemy vehicles. Enemy vehicles destroyed by Platoon mates count toward this total.\n• Can be completed either on your own or as part of a Platoon consisting of your tank destroyer and any other vehicles.

PM.name: TD-14: Big Hunt (Personal/Platoon)
PM.desc: A well-coordinated Platoon of tank destroyers will not allow the enemy to outflank their team's positions. This mission may be completed either as part of a Platoon or on your own, however, the latter is much more difficult.
PM.Hint: Provide covering fire for members of your Platoon who have taken a beating. Sometimes it is better to draw enemy fire yourself in order to give an ally a chance to retreat to safety.

Primary.req: • Cause at least 25% of the total damage caused to enemy vehicles by your team. Damage caused by Platoon mates counts toward this total.\n• Win the battle.\n• Can be completed either on your own or as part of a Platoon consisting of your tank destroyer and any other vehicles.

PM.name: TD-15: Triumph
PM.desc: When diplomacy fails, the guns start to speak. So get your loaded word in.
PM.Hint: The more damage you cause in a battle, the better the chance of victory for your team. It is a simple rule that you should remember.

Primary.req: • Cause at least 4,000 HP of damage to enemy vehicles.

PM.name: SPG-1: The Sharpshooter
PM.desc: Do not waste your ammunition. It is the precise hits that will bring you victory.
PM.Hint: Be patient and wait until you are fully aimed at the target.

Primary.req: • Score at least 4 hits that cause damage to enemy vehicles.

Secondary.req: • Cause at least 2,000 HP of damage.

PM.name: SPG-2: Hidden and Dangerous
PM.desc: SPGs cannot rely on the thickness of their armor or their speed. If you drive an SPG, learn how to stay concealed during the whole battle.
PM.Hint: The Camouflage Net equipment combined with the Camouflage crew skill will help you stay unspotted.

Primary.req: • Cause at least 1,500 HP of damage to enemy vehicles. Remain unspotted during the battle.\n• Survive the battle.

PM.name: SPG-3: Howitzer Strike
PM.desc: If you want to become an asset to the team, you have to learn how to shoot effectively first.
PM.Hint: Follow the flow of the battle and support your team. Do not stand in one spot for too long. Retreat or look for another firing position if needed.

Primary.req: • Cause at least 2,000 HP of damage to enemy vehicles.

PM.name: SPG-4: Break On Through
PM.desc: Powerful HE shells can not only cause damage in terms of hit points, but will also have a good chance of damaging or destroying modules or injuring crew members with splash damage.
PM.Hint: A High-Explosive shell is most devastating when it fully penetrates the armor and explodes inside the hull of an enemy vehicle. If your shells have mediocre penetration, try to find an enemy vehicle with an open-top turret, or load a Premium shell.

Primary.req: • Damage or destroy enemy vehicles’ modules or injure members of their crew, totaling at least 5 modules and crew members.\n• The numbers of damaged/destroyed modules and injured crew members across all enemy vehicles you have damaged in the battle are added together.

PM.name: SPG-5: Calculate & Obliterate
PM.desc: The great firepower you possess compensates well for the relatively low durability of your SPG.
PM.Hint: Try to cause damage to enemy vehicles at the first opportunity. Even if your HE shell misses the enemy, a near miss may still cause damage to the target.

Primary.req: • Cause damage exceeding 6 times the hit points of your vehicle.\n• Damage caused to allies is not counted.

PM.name: SPG-6: The Falling Hammer
PM.desc: Often you will fight against vehicles of a higher tier. But that is not a problem for an experienced SPG driver.
PM.Hint: SPGs, with their arcing shell trajectory, can often hit a target on the top of the turret or the engine deck, areas where the armor protection is usually weak. Enemy vehicles with open turrets are even more vulnerable to destruction from above. Against the heaviest targets, you may have to resort to Premium shells.

Primary.req: • Destroy at least 3 enemy vehicles of the same tier as your vehicle or higher.

PM.name: SPG-7: Roll Out the Big Guns
PM.desc: You should destroy enemy tank destroyers and SPGs any chance you get. Taking them out may turn the tide of battle in your favor.
PM.Hint: Coordinate your actions with allied light tanks. Spotting enemy tank destroyers and SPGs and destroying them can help to achieve superiority on the battlefield.

Primary.req: • Destroy an enemy tank destroyer or SPG that is 1 tier higher than your vehicle.

Secondary.req: • Cause at least 2,000 HP of damage.

PM.name: SPG-8: Heavy Fire on Heavy Tanks!
PM.desc: A heavy tank is a hard target, but not for your gun. The sight of heavy tank in the open should make you smile.
PM.Hint: Heavy tanks generally move more slowly than other types of vehicles. Therefore, you can often predict where the tank will be when your shell arrives. For an SPG driver, it is useful to know the speed of your shells.

Primary.req: • Cause at least 1,500 HP of damage to enemy heavy tanks.

Secondary.req: • Destroy at least 2 enemy heavy tanks.

PM.name: SPG-9: Lead Them Til You Hit Them
PM.desc: An experienced SPG driver can easily hit moving vehicles. Learn to effectively predict the movement of enemy vehicles when firing. Remember that a direct hit can cause much more damage to an enemy vehicle than an HE splash.
PM.Hint: Knowing the velocity of your shells is crucial. By estimating how long the shell will take to reach the aim point, you can correctly lead a moving target.

Primary.req: • Score at least 2 direct hits on enemy vehicles.\n• All direct hits, whether or not they caused damage, are counted.

Secondary.req: • Survive the battle.\n• Win the battle.

PM.name: SPG-10: The Bane of Artillery
PM.desc: Artillery can be quite good at destroying artillery. Watch for falling trees and broken fences. Predict where an enemy SPG may be hiding and send a shell to test your hypothesis.
PM.Hint: As you become more experienced with artillery, you will get to know the \"standard\" artillery hiding places on each map. Make enemy SPGs pay for their lack of creativity.

Primary.req: • Destroy at least 2 enemy SPGs.

PM.name: SPG-11: The Area of Effect
PM.desc: Your HE shells can not only destroy an enemy vehicle in one hit, but they can also cause significant damage to multiple targets at once if they are located close together.
PM.Hint: Keep your eye on choke points and busy corners where vehicles are likely to stack up. You can literally kill two birds with one stone. And ammunition is not free: think of the savings!

Primary.req: • Cause damage to at least 2 enemy vehicles with a single shot.

PM.name: SPG-12: The Striker
PM.desc: Playing an SPG is drastically different from playing any other vehicle type. But the main objective is the same—do your best in battle, and contribute as much as you can to the team's cause.
PM.Hint: Do not switch to Artillery mode at the very beginning of the battle. First, decide on a good firing position.

Primary.req: • Be among the top 3 players on both teams by damage caused.\n• Destroy at least 2 enemy vehicles.\n• Survive the battle.

PM.name: SPG-13: The Artillery Battery (Personal/Platoon)
