Primary.req: • Cause at least 4,000 HP of damage to enemy vehicles.

Secondary.req: • Win the battle.\n• Survive the battle.

PM.name: SPG-4: Break On Through
PM.desc: Powerful HE shells can not only cause damage in terms of hit points, but will also have a good chance of damaging or destroying modules or injuring crew members with splash damage.
PM.Hint: A High-Explosive shell is most devastating when it fully penetrates the armor and explodes inside the hull of an enemy vehicle. If your shells have mediocre penetration, try to find an enemy vehicle with an open-top turret, or load a Premium shell.

Primary.req: • Damage or destroy enemy vehicles’ modules or injure members of their crew, totaling at least 10 modules and crew members.\n• The numbers of damaged/destroyed modules and injured crew members across all enemy vehicles you have damaged in the battle are added together.

Secondary.req: • Win the battle.\n• Survive the battle.

PM.name: SPG-5: Calculate & Obliterate
PM.desc: The great firepower you possess compensates well for the relatively low durability of your SPG.
PM.Hint: Try to cause damage to enemy vehicles at the first opportunity. Even if your HE shell misses the enemy, a near miss may still cause damage to the target.

Primary.req: • Cause damage exceeding 10 times the hit points of your vehicle.\n• Damage caused to allies is not counted.

PM.name: SPG-6: The Falling Hammer
PM.desc: Often you will fight against vehicles of a higher tier. But that is not a problem for an experienced SPG driver.
PM.Hint: SPGs, with their arcing shell trajectory, can often hit a target on the top of the turret or the engine deck, areas where the armor protection is usually weak. Enemy vehicles with open turrets are even more vulnerable to destruction from above. Against the heaviest targets, you may have to resort to Premium shells.

Primary.req: • Destroy at least 2 enemy vehicles that are 2 tiers higher than your vehicle.

Secondary.req: • Win the battle.\n• Survive the battle.

PM.name: SPG-7: Roll Out the Big Guns
PM.desc: You should destroy enemy tank destroyers and SPGs any chance you get. Taking them out may turn the tide of battle in your favor.
PM.Hint: Coordinate your actions with allied light tanks. Spotting enemy tank destroyers and SPGs and destroying them can help to achieve superiority on the battlefield.

Primary.req: • Destroy a total of at least 3 enemy tank destroyers and SPGs.\n• Win the battle.

Secondary.req: • Cause at least 4,000 HP of damage.

PM.name: SPG-8: Heavy Fire on Heavy Tanks!
PM.desc: A heavy tank is a hard target, but not for your gun. The sight of heavy tank in the open should make you smile.
PM.Hint: Heavy tanks generally move more slowly than other types of vehicles. Therefore, you can often predict where the tank will be when your shell arrives. For an SPG driver, it is useful to know the speed of your shells.

Primary.req: • Cause at least 3,000 HP of damage to enemy heavy tanks.

Secondary.req: • Destroy at least 2 enemy heavy tanks.\n• Win the battle.

PM.name: SPG-9: Lead Them Til You Hit Them
PM.desc: An experienced SPG driver can easily hit moving vehicles. Learn to effectively predict the movement of enemy vehicles when firing. Remember that a direct hit can cause much more damage to an enemy vehicle than an HE splash.
PM.Hint: Knowing the velocity of your shells is crucial. By estimating how long the shell will take to reach the aim point, you can correctly lead a moving target.

Primary.req: • Score at least 4 direct hits on enemy vehicles.\n• All direct hits, whether or not they caused damage, are counted.

Secondary.req: • Survive the battle.\n• Win the battle.\n• Remain unspotted for the battle.

PM.name: SPG-10: The Bane of Artillery
PM.desc: Artillery can be quite good at destroying artillery. Watch for falling trees and broken fences. Predict where an enemy SPG may be hiding and send a shell to test your hypothesis.
PM.Hint: As you become more experienced with artillery, you will get to know the \"standard\" artillery hiding places on each map. Make enemy SPGs pay for their lack of creativity.

Primary.req: • Destroy at least 2 enemy SPGs.\n• Cause at least 4,000 HP of damage to enemy vehicles.

PM.name: SPG-11: The Area of Effect
PM.desc: Your HE shells can not only destroy an enemy vehicle in one hit, but they can also cause significant damage to multiple targets at once if they are located close together.
PM.Hint: Keep your eye on choke points and busy corners where vehicles are likely to stack up. You can literally kill two birds with one stone. And ammunition is not free: think of the savings!

Primary.req: • Destroy at least 2 enemy vehicles with a single shot.

Secondary.req: • Win the battle.\n• Survive the battle.

PM.name: SPG-12: The Striker
PM.desc: Playing an SPG is drastically different from playing any other vehicle type. But the main objective is the same—do your best in battle, and contribute as much as you can to the team's cause.
PM.Hint: Do not switch to Artillery mode at the very beginning of the battle. First, decide on a good firing position.

Primary.req: • Finish the battle as the top player on both teams by damage caused.\n• Destroy at least 4 enemy vehicles.\n• Survive the battle.

PM.name: SPG-13: The Artillery Battery (Personal/Platoon)
PM.desc: A Platoon of well-handled SPGs should make the enemy team extremely worried. Coordinate your actions and focus your fire on one enemy target at a time. This mission may be completed either as part of a Platoon or on your own, however, the latter is much more difficult.
PM.Hint: By spreading out, your Platoon can hit targets from different angles, rendering many rocks and buildings useless as cover and dominating the map.

Primary.req: • Cause at least 30% of the total damage caused to enemy vehicles by your team. Damage caused by Platoon mates counts toward this total.\n• Win the battle.\n• Can be completed either on your own or as part of a Platoon consisting of your SPG and any other vehicles.

PM.name: SPG-14: Joint Offensive (Personal/Platoon)
PM.desc: Artillery is dependent on the rest of the team to be successful. Artillery and light tanks complement each other especially well in a Platoon. This mission may be completed either as part of a Platoon or on your own, however, the latter is much more difficult.
PM.Hint: A light tank can spot enemy vehicles and immobilize them, allowing SPGs to make short work of the unfortunate victim. A heavy tank can shield allies with its thick armor, a medium tank can distract the enemy, while a tank destroyer can provide fire support at long range. Together we will win!

Primary.req: • Cause at least 5,000 HP of damage to enemy heavy tanks and tank destroyers. Damage caused by Platoon mates counts toward this total.\n• Can be completed either on your own or as part of a Platoon consisting of your SPG and any other vehicles.

PM.name: SPG-15: War Gods
PM.desc: An SPG, played well and properly supported, can be a dominant weapon.
PM.Hint: Know the technical characteristics of your SPG and plan your actions accordingly. Sometimes, remaining at the base is not a very good idea. If you are driving a fast SPG, you can quickly change positions and engage the enemy from an unexpected direction.

Primary.req: • Finish the battle as the top player on both teams by experience earned and damage caused.\n• Cause at least 3,000 HP of damage.

PM.name: SH-1: The Colors of Superiority
PM.desc: A delivered or destroyed flag is an important milestone on your way to victory. Take your time and explore the map to determine the safest and fastest path for delivering a flag.
PM.Hint: High-speed vehicles are the most effective flag hunters. While carrying the flag, try performing unpredictable maneuvers, such as moving in zigzags and weaving, to make you a harder target to hit.

Primary.req: • Deliver or destroy at least 2 flags.\n• Flags only appear in battles with Platoons.

Secondary.req: • Cause at least 7,000 HP of damage to enemy vehicles by shooting or ramming them.\n• Results achieved in all vehicles that you selected for the battle are added together.

PM.name: SH-2: Skyfall
PM.desc: If a battle gets too tough, use Combat Reserves. Call in artillery strikes and airstrikes wisely and remember that cooldowns take time.
PM.Hint: Damage caused with Combat Reserves is added to your personal score. Damage or destroy enemy vehicles with artillery strikes and airstrikes to earn victory points.

Primary.req: • Earn at least 100 victory points.

Secondary.req: • Cause at least 1,000 HP of damage with Combat Reserves.

PM.name: SH-3: Shoot the Messenger
PM.desc: Every flag the enemy delivers brings them closer to victory, which certainly isn't what you want. Focus your fire—do not allow the flag carrier to reach the base.
PM.Hint: You earn more points for delivering a flag than for destroying an enemy vehicle. Whenever you have a choice, intercepting the flag carrier is always more beneficial than getting involved in a firefight.

Primary.req: • Destroy at least 1 enemy vehicle carrying a flag by shooting or ramming it.\n• Flags only appear in battles with Platoons.

Secondary.req: • Earn at least 1,500 XP in the battle.

PM.name: SH-4: First to Fight
PM.desc: Try to avoid mistakes on the front line: there is not much time for tactical planning, and the enemy must be destroyed quickly and decisively.
PM.Hint: It might be a good idea to select a vehicle with a clip first while completing this mission. A fully loaded clip has enough shells to destroy almost any enemy vehicle.

Primary.req: • Destroy 1 enemy vehicle during the first 2 minutes of the battle by shooting or ramming it.

Secondary.req: • Do not lose more than 3 of your vehicles in the battle.

PM.name: SH-5: Warpath
PM.desc: In order to succeed, try to aim your shots carefully. Every miss, ricochet, and non-penetration will decrease your chance of taking and keeping the lead by damage caused.
PM.Hint: Consider choosing a vehicle with high firepower. Be cautious: time spent repairing your vehicle is time not spent dealing damage to the enemy.

Primary.req: • Cause at least 6,000 HP of damage to enemy vehicles by shooting or ramming them.\n• Results achieved in all vehicles that you selected for the battle are added together.

Secondary.req: • Destroy at least 4 enemy vehicles by shooting or ramming them.\n• Results achieved in all vehicles that you selected for the battle are added together.

PM.name: SH-6: Thor's Hammer
PM.desc: Do not underestimate Combat Reserves: when used correctly, they can cause considerable damage to enemy vehicles.
PM.Hint: Try to use Combat Reserves to catch enemy vehicles at choke points to make it more difficult for them to maneuver out and evade their imminent destruction. You can also block the enemy with your own vehicle, but try to avoid being hit by your own Combat Reserves.

Primary.req: • Cause at least 2,000 HP of damage with Combat Reserves.

Secondary.req: • Destroy at least 4 enemy vehicles by shooting or ramming them.\n• Results achieved in all vehicles that you selected for the battle are added together.

PM.name: SH-7: Return Fire Part 1
PM.desc: Conserve your hit points. Remember: a destroyed vehicle will neither deal damage nor deliver a flag to base.
PM.Hint: A reckless rush at the enemy will only get you destroyed faster than you can say \"woops\". Instead, sneak the flag out and retreat to deliver it safely to your base.

Primary.req:
• Cause at least 8,000 HP of damage to enemy vehicles by shooting or ramming them.
• Deliver or destroy at least 2 flags in the battle.
• Flags only appear in battles with Platoons.
• Results achieved in all vehicles that you selected for the battle are added together.

Secondary.req: • Destroy at least 5 enemy vehicles by shooting or ramming them.\n• Results achieved in all vehicles that you selected for the battle are added together.

PM.name: SH-8: Wild Card
PM.desc: You can affect the result of any firefight by calling in an artillery strike or an airstrike at the right place and time.
PM.Hint: To complete this mission, be on the lookout for battered enemy vehicles that can be destroyed by a few well-placed hits. Do not forget to avoid the allied artillery strikes and airstrikes.

Primary.req: • Destroy at least 3 enemy vehicles with Combat Reserves.

Secondary.req: • Earn at least 1,700 XP in the battle.

PM.name: SH-9: Sabotage
PM.desc: You can harm enemy vehicles by causing damage or by damaging and destroying their modules. Each critical hit substantially reduces the battle performance of the enemy.
PM.Hint: The Deadeye perk increases the chance of a critical hit and can make life easier. Remember: internal vehicle modules include the turret ring, engine, fuel tanks, ammo rack and radio.

Primary.req:
• Damage or destroy enemy vehicles’ internal modules or injure members of their crew, totaling at least 12 modules and crew members.
• Damage caused with Combat Reserves is not counted.
• Results achieved in all vehicles that you selected for the battle are added together.
• Critical damage to the enemy vehicle caused by fire after the player's vehicle was destroyed is not counted.

Secondary.req: • Cause at least 8,000 HP of damage to enemy vehicles by shooting or ramming them.\n• Results achieved in all vehicles that you selected for the battle are added together.

PM.name: SH-10: All Shall Fall
PM.desc: Knowing the vulnerable spots for each type of vehicle is key to a successful encounter. Remember: heavy tanks use robust armor, tank destroyers rely on concealment, while light and medium tanks have high speed and maneuverability. Each type of enemy vehicle requires particular tactics to counter them.
PM.Hint: Watch your six: fast enemies can flank you, making your vehicle easy prey. Pay extra attention when crossing exposed areas, as tank destroyers can catch you under fire of their high-caliber guns.

Primary.req: • Destroy at least 10 enemy vehicles by shooting or ramming them.\n• Results achieved in all vehicles that you selected for the battle are added together.

Secondary.req: • Cause at least 1,500 HP of damage with Combat Reserves.

PM.name: SH-11: Return Fire Part 2
PM.desc: Rule #1: Survive. Respond to each enemy shot, use cunning tactics, flank and outmaneuver enemy vehicles.
PM.Hint: Look for battered enemy vehicles instead of trying to destroy vehicles with full HP.

Primary.req: • Destroy at least three times as many enemy vehicles, by shooting or ramming them, as the number of your vehicles lost in the battle.\n• Destroy at least 7 enemy vehicles by shooting or ramming them.\n• Results achieved in all vehicles that you selected for the battle are added together.

Secondary.req: • Earn at least 1,800 XP in the battle.

PM.name: SH-12: Under Your Skin
PM.desc: Even the toughest beast can be stopped by a single shot if you know where to strike. Heavy armor is of little concern to a skilled shooter.
PM.Hint: Using Premium shells allows you to damage enemies with the heaviest armor protection.

Primary.req: • Destroy at least 8 enemy vehicles by shooting or ramming them.\n• Cause at least 6,000 HP of damage to enemy vehicles by shooting or ramming them.\n• Results achieved in all vehicles that you selected for the battle are added together.

Secondary.req: • Do not lose more than 2 of your vehicles in the battle.

PM.name: SH-13: Up Close and Personal
PM.desc: Close combat tactics are quite different from ranged combat: your vehicle has limited space to maneuver, and the enemy may get a lucky hit. In addition, on some maps, the only chance to cause damage lies in getting as close to the enemy as possible.
PM.Hint: Keep on rolling! Enable Auto-Aim for easier aiming on the move (by default, right-click while aiming at the enemy).

Primary.req: • Cause at least 12,000 HP of damage to enemy vehicles by shooting or ramming them.\n• Results achieved in all vehicles that you selected for the battle are added together.

Secondary.req: • Destroy at least 5 enemy vehicles by shooting or ramming them.\n• Results achieved in all vehicles that you selected for the battle are added together.

PM.name: SH-14: The Heat of Battle
PM.desc: You earn experience for delivering or destroying a flag, spotting, causing damage, and destroying enemy vehicles. Prove your worth and accumulate as much experience as you can.
PM.Hint: Avoid getting caught in crossfire or direct enemy fire. Float like a butterfly, sting like a bee.

Primary.req: • Cause at least 10,000 HP of damage to enemy vehicles by shooting or ramming them.\n• Do not lose any of your vehicles in the battle.

Secondary.req: • Cause at least 1,500 HP of damage with Combat Reserves.

PM.name: SH-15: Checkmate
PM.desc: Your moment of glory has come! You have already explored the maps and learned what to expect from enemy vehicles: it is time to test your mettle.
PM.Hint: Take your time when selecting vehicles, equipment, and consumables. Consider adding some Premium shells; make sure you enter battle with a trained crew. Roll out!

Primary.req: • Finish the battle as the top player by experience and victory points earned.\n• Cause at least 12,000 HP of damage to enemy vehicles by shooting or ramming them.\n• Results achieved in all vehicles that you selected for the battle are added together.

Secondary.req: • Destroy at least 7 enemy vehicles by shooting or ramming them.\n• Results achieved in all vehicles that you selected for the battle are added together.

PM.name: D-1: Team Player
PM.desc: Causing damage, destroying enemy vehicles, and delivering flags will earn you victory points. The more you contribute to the cause in battle, the faster your team wins.
PM.Hint: Do not always rush into the very epicenter of battle. Sometimes, amid the chaotic fighting, it is more sensible to grab the flag and deliver it to your base.

Primary.req: • Earn at least 50 victory points.\n• Cause at least 2,000 HP of damage to enemy vehicles by shooting or ramming them.\n• Results achieved in all vehicles that you selected for the battle are added together.

PM.name: D-2: Accelerate & Eliminate
PM.desc: It might be a good idea to select a vehicle with a clip first while completing this mission. A fully loaded clip has enough shells to destroy almost any enemy vehicle.
PM.Hint: To stay concealed, try to keep your distance from the enemy. Shooting at enemy vehicles spotted by your allies will help you to remain undetected.

Primary.req: • Destroy at least 1 enemy vehicle during the first 2 minutes of the battle by shooting or ramming it.

PM.name: D-3: Set Fire to the Rain
PM.desc: You will have the ability to request Combat Reserves and surprise the enemy with a sudden attack from artillery or warplanes. Remember, Combat Reserves have a cooldown period after each use.
PM.Hint: Try to use Combat Reserves to catch enemy vehicles at choke points to make it more difficult for them to maneuver out and evade their imminent destruction. You can also block the enemy with your own vehicle, but try to avoid being hit by your own Combat Reserves.

Primary.req: • Cause at least 1,000 HP of damage with Combat Reserves.

Secondary.req: • Destroy at least 2 enemy vehicles by shooting or ramming them.

PM.name: D-4: Flank You Very Much
PM.desc: You will encounter different types of vehicles in battle. Different vehicles call for different combat tactics. However, it is always a good idea to flank an enemy vehicle and attack it from the rear, where their armor is thinner.
PM.Hint: If you know where important modules are located in an enemy vehicle, you can hit them where it hurts the most. For example, shooting an enemy vehicle's fuel tanks can set it on fire. Once ignited, they will not last long.

Primary.req: • Cause at least 2,500 HP of damage to enemy heavy tanks by shooting or ramming them.\n• Cause at least 2,500 HP of damage to enemy medium tanks by shooting or ramming them.\n• Results achieved in all vehicles that you selected for the battle are added together.

PM.name: D-5: Sitting Duck
PM.desc: Immobilizing an enemy vehicle means that it will be unable to evade fire or artillery strikes and airstrikes, making them an easy target.
PM.Hint: Aim for the drive wheels, the sprocketed wheels at the front or rear of the suspension. Do not forget to draw the attention of your allies to the target vehicle by selecting \"Requesting fire at…\" from the Command Menu.

Primary.req: • Destroy the tracks of at least 4 enemy vehicles by shooting or ramming them.\n• Shoot and destroy 1 enemy vehicle, having received no prior damage to your vehicle.

PM.name: D-6: Just a Shot Away
PM.desc: You earn victory points by causing damage to enemy vehicles. Use your combat skills effectively: aim your shots carefully and evade enemy fire.
PM.Hint: It is not always a good idea to chase battered enemy vehicles; they might be luring you into a trap. Do not let the enemy surround you.

Primary.req: • Cause at least 6,000 HP of damage to enemy vehicles by shooting or ramming them.\n• Do not lose more than 1 of your vehicles in the battle.\n• Results achieved in all vehicles that you selected for the battle are added together.

PM.name: D-7: Nerves of Steel
PM.desc: Do not overestimate your armor protection: avoid exposing your vehicle's sides and rear to enemy fire. Try to quickly withdraw from artillery strike and airstrike zones.
PM.Hint: Tо complete this mission, choose heavily armored vehicles with high durability. The more ricochets and non-penetrating hits you receive, the closer you are to reaching your objective.

Primary.req:
• Damage caused and damage blocked by armor must total at least 8,000 HP.
• Damage caused with or received from Combat Reserves is not counted.
• Fire at least 5 shots that cause damage to enemy vehicles.
• Results achieved in all vehicles that you selected for the battle are added together.

Secondary.req: • Cause at least 3,000 HP of damage to enemy vehicles by shooting or ramming them.\n• Results achieved in all vehicles that you selected for the battle are added together.

PM.name: D-8: Thunder and Lightning
PM.desc: Do not underestimate Combat Reserves: a single, perfectly timed artillery strike or airstrike can crush any enemy.
PM.Hint: To complete this mission, be on the lookout for battered enemy vehicles that can be destroyed by a few well-placed hits. Do not forget to avoid allied artillery strikes and airstrikes.

Primary.req: • Destroy at least 2 enemy vehicles with Combat Reserves.\n• Earn at least 150 victory points.

PM.name: D-9: Ultimate Survival
PM.desc: Thick sloped armor is a major obstacle for enemy shells. Hide your vehicle's weak spots, flank the enemy, and deliver the maximum amount of damage.
PM.Hint: Try catching the enemy off guard; attack, and withdraw rapidly. Consider choosing vehicles with sturdy armor that are capable of withstanding enemy fire.

Primary.req: • Damage caused and damage blocked by armor must total at least 10,000 HP.\n•Damage caused with or received from Combat Reserves is not counted.\n• Results achieved in all vehicles that you selected for the battle are added together.

Secondary.req: • Do not lose more than 2 of your vehicles in the battle.

PM.name: D-10: Near, Far, Wherever You Are
PM.desc: You can effectively engage the enemy at both long and short ranges. The former involves relying on weapon accuracy, the latter—on vehicle maneuverability and speed.
PM.Hint: For long-range combat, choose a firing position that will allow you to cover multiple areas: sooner or later the enemy will stumble into one of them. For close combat, consider using a vehicle with a clip to quickly cause massive damage.

Primary.req: • Cause at least 3,000 HP of damage to enemy vehicles from a distance of more than 200 m by shooting them.\n• Cause at least 3,000 HP of damage to enemy vehicles from a distance of less than 150 m by shooting or ramming them.\n• Results achieved in all vehicles that you selected for the battle are added together.

Secondary.req: • Cause at least 500 HP of damage with Combat Reserves.

PM.name: D-11: All Is Fair...
PM.desc: This time you will have to use all of your skills and knowledge to emerge victorious. Different vehicle types have different qualities that must be taken into account during combat.
PM.Hint: A close encounter with certain enemies can be catastrophic for your vehicle. Such threats are better disposed of via an artillery strike or airstrike. Another good use of Combat Reserves is destroying slow, hulking vehicles that will not be able to leave the strike zone.

Primary.req: • Destroy at least 2 enemy vehicles with Combat Reserves.\n• Destroy at least 8 enemy vehicles by shooting or ramming them.\n• Results achieved in all vehicles that you selected for the battle are added together.

PM.name: D-12: Force to Be Reckoned With
PM.desc: It is time they saw who runs the show. Cause damage, destroy enemy vehicles, and deliver flags. These actions will increase your victory points.
PM.Hint: Remember: although you need to outperform both enemies and allies, cooperation on the battlefield is the key to success.

Primary.req: • Finish the battle as the top player of both teams by victory points earned.\n• Earn at least 350 victory points.\n• Results achieved in all vehicles that you selected for the battle are added together.

PM.name: D-13: Hunting Giants
PM.desc: Higher tier vehicles have better combat characteristics, which may be a problem when you try to destroy them. To succeed in battle, you need to know the weak spots of an enemy vehicle.
PM.Hint: Do not forget to bring a few Premium shells to battle.

Primary.req: • Destroy at least 10 enemy vehicles, of 2 different types, by shooting or ramming them.\n• Results achieved in all vehicles that you selected for the battle are added together.

Secondary.req: • Do not lose any of your vehicles in the battle.

PM.name: D-14: Critical Acclaim
PM.desc: To complete this mission, consider using vehicles with a high rate of fire and a good view range. Make sure you know the location of internal modules and crew members. Remember: the longer you remain in battle and the more accurately you fire, the higher your chance of causing the required number of critical hits.
PM.Hint: The Deadeye perk increases the chance of a critical hit and can make things a lot easier. To increase the fighting range, use Coated Optics or Binocular Telescope.

Primary.req:
• Damage or destroy enemy vehicles’ modules or injure members of their crew, totaling at least 10 modules and crew members, by shooting them.
• Cause at least 10,000 HP of damage to enemy vehicles within the view range of your vehicle, by shooting or ramming them.
• Results achieved in all vehicles that you selected for the battle are added together.
• Critical damage to the enemy vehicle caused by fire after the player's vehicle was destroyed is not counted.

PM.name: D-15: Veni, Vidi, Vici
PM.desc: It is time to show all the skills under your belt. From selecting the right vehicle and equipment for the mission, to planning the perfect strategy for the battle.
PM.Hint: Luck is an essential part of victory, but it only benefits those who maintain control and hold back the enemy. To arms!

Primary.req: • Finish the battle as the top player of both teams by experience and victory points earned.\n• Cause at least 15,000 HP of damage to enemy vehicles by shooting or ramming them.\n• Results achieved in all vehicles that you selected for the battle are added together.

Secondary.req: • Do not lose any of your vehicles in the battle.
